properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. ### Intense lightning is likely with any thunderstorm that develops. Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.

properties.Title: Special Weather Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Unseasonably warm weather expected for the start of the Canada Day weekend. Today and Sunday are shaping up to be sunny with afternoon cloudy periods and isolated afternoon showers on Sunday. Temperatures will be about 5 degrees above seasonal normals for the period. Temperatures will be close to the Heat Warning criteria of at least 28 C for two or more consecutive days with an overnight low above 13 C. However, the amount of cloud cover, forest fire smoke and overnight cooling are still uncertain at this time and will play a major role in determining the temperatures. A Heat Warning may be issued later if conditions warrant. - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Contact your local government to find out what services (such as air-conditioned buildings and public splash parks) are available in your area. - Environment and Climate Change Canada and Regional Medical Health officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. ### Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-29T20:45:05-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T12:46:05-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.2017403534.2019

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain this afternoon and this evening. Boaters may be surprised by strong gusts over bodies of water. ### Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to QCstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #QCStorm.

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Today and Sunday will be unseasonably hot. Conditions look to be on track for today and Sunday to meet the criteria for a Heat Warning. Daytime highs are expected to reach near 29 C with the overnight low falling to near 13 C. This puts temperatures about 5 to 7 degrees above seasonal norms. Cooler weather returns on Monday. However, there are some competing factors such as, afternoon cloud cover, possible showers, and forest fire smoke, that may throw a wrench into the forecast. Heat warnings are issued when daytime highs are forecast to reach at least 28 C for two consecutive days and the overnight low doesn't fall below 13 C. ### To get more information: - Check the local news for health and safety updates. - Check HealthLinkBC online resources about heat-related illness and how to protect yourself at www.healthlinkbc.ca/healthlinkbc-files/heat-related-illness. - Call HealthLinkBC at 8-1-1 to ask about heat-related illness. Environment Canada and local Medical Health Officers expect an increase in health and safety risks from heat and are advising the public to take precautions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather in British Columbia or Yukon, send an email to BCstorm@canada.ca or YTstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #BCStorm or #YTStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T09:59:58-00:00

properties.Title: Special Air Quality Statement In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Wildfire smoke is creating locally reduced visibilities and producing poor air quality. ### Individuals may experience symptoms such as increased coughing, throat irritation, headaches or shortness of breath. Children, seniors, and those with cardiovascular or lung disease, such as asthma, are especially at risk. For more information please visit Alberta Health Services at www.albertahealthservices.ca/news/air.aspx. Visit www.airhealth.ca for information on how to reduce your health risk and your personal contribution to pollution levels, as well as for current and forecast AQHI values. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada.
Expires: 2019-06-30T02:38:13-00:00

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: First heat event of the season ends tonight. One more hot and humid day is expected today with afternoon temperatures in the low thirties and humidex values nudging 40. The hot and humid air today can also bring deteriorating air quality and can result in the Air Quality Health Index to approach the high risk category. A cooler and considerably less humid air mass is expected to arrive from the northwest this evening, with temperatures several degrees lower on Sunday. Hot and humid weather is expected to return to the area early next week. ### The risks are greater for young children, pregnant women, older adults, people with chronic illnesses and people working or exercising outdoors. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T02:59:20-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T14:33:20-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.3558652863.2019
Area: Chatham-Kent - Rondeau Park, Windsor - Leamington - Essex County
properties.Author: Environment Canada

properties.Title: Heat Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: A multi-day heat event continues through the long weekend. After some brief relief early this morning with temperature dipping to the low to mid teens in many areas, temperatures will once again soar to near the 30 degree mark this afternoon. Temperatures tonight will likely fall to the upper teens, providing little relief from the heat. Additionally humidex values will likely reach the high thirties, particularly near the Minnesota border. Slightly lower temperatures are expected to arrive early next week. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T06:50:28-00:00
Originated from CAP Alert: Environment Canada, 2019-06-29T14:51:28-00:00, urn:oid:2.49.0.1.124.1431066465.2019

properties.Title: Rainfall Warning In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Rain, at times heavy, continues. A slow moving low pressure system continues to affect west central Alberta. Rain is expected to continue in the Grand Cache region until this afternoon. Storm totals by this afternoon are expected to be 50 to 75 mm. ### Heavy downpours can cause flash floods and water pooling on roads. Rainfall warnings are issued when significant rainfall is expected. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ABstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ABStorm.
Expires: 2019-06-30T01:59:58-00:00

properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts and large hail. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Description: Humidex values reaching 35 are expected for the next 3 days. A multi-day heat event continues through the long weekend. After some brief relief early this morning with temperature dipping to the low to mid teens in many areas, temperatures will once again soar to near the 30 degree mark this afternoon. Temperatures tonight will likely fall to the upper teens, providing little relief from the heat. Additionally humidex values will likely reach the high thirties, particularly near the Minnesota border. Slightly lower temperatures are expected to arrive next week. ### Watch for the effects of heat illness: swelling, rash, cramps, fainting, heat exhaustion, heat stroke and the worsening of some health conditions. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to ONstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #ONStorm.

properties.Title: Severe Thunderstorm Watch In Effect
properties.Summary:
Description: Conditions are favourable for the development of severe thunderstorms that may be capable of producing strong wind gusts, large hail and heavy rain. Isolated severe thunderstorms are likely to develop throughout the day and continue into the evening. ### Remember, severe thunderstorms can produce tornadoes. Severe thunderstorm watches are issued when atmospheric conditions are favourable for the development of thunderstorms that could produce one or more of the following: large hail, damaging winds, torrential rainfall. Please continue to monitor alerts and forecasts issued by Environment Canada. To report severe weather, send an email to SKstorm@canada.ca or tweet reports using #SKStorm.
